entities.description: The time frame of the past 30 days, including today's date.
Number of whole days missed from school due to sickness or injury.
The reason for missing school, specifically due to being sick or injured.
Number of days missed due to staying home with a sick child or family member.
The use of tobacco, alcohol, and drugs by the respondent.
Disorders related to the use of tobacco, alcohol, and drugs.
Issues related to the mental health of the respondent.
Substance use or mental health treatment received by the respondent.
Economic status of the respondent, including income level.
Educational attainment level of the respondent.
Indication if the respondent lives in a rural area.
Availability of infrastructure in the respondent's area, such as healthcare facilities.
Policies and laws relevant to substance use and mental health treatment.

relationships.description: Relates the survey to the time period of the past 30 days.
Indicates the number of days the respondent missed school due to sickness or injury.
Defines the reason for the school absence, such as being sick or injured.
Indicates the number of days the respondent missed school due to caring for a sick child or family member.
Indicates the use of tobacco, alcohol, or drugs by the respondent.
Indicates if the respondent has a disorder related to substance use.
Indicates if the respondent has mental health issues.
Indicates if the respondent received any substance use or mental health treatment.
Defines the economic status of the respondent.
Defines the educational attainment level of the respondent.
Indicates if the respondent lives in a rural area.
Defines the availability of infrastructure in the rural area.
Indicates if the respondent is affected by certain legal policies.
